answers.answer: Your reaction to the news is understandable. The good news is that if you continue to use the machine your chances of medical complications will be minimized. By definition, with obstructive sleep apnea, you automatically wake up after a long pause in your breathing. The danger comes in when after years of straining the heart, you can develop heart disease, along with all the other associated medical complications such as hypertension, diabetes, depression, heart attack or stroke.

question: I have just diagnosed as having very severe Chronic Obstructive Sleep Apnea.  While doing my study they had to turn the machine up to 14,before I could fall into a deep restful sleep.Does this mean that I am going to die in my sleep sometime,anytime soon?  I am frightened by this very disturbing thought.Susie
title: Is Sleep Apnea dangerous?
